short_description: Explore the Central African Republic, a landlocked nation in the heart of Africa known for its diverse wildlife, pristine national parks, and rich cultural heritage. Discover the Dzanga-Sangha Reserve, experience traditional cultures, and immerse yourself in the natural beauty of this Central African nation.

health.tap_water_safety: Not safe to drink - bottled or filtered water is recommended
alcohol_info: It is prohibited to sell, serve, or offer alcohol beverages to anyone under the age of 18
Alcohol can be purchased from licensed venues, restaurants, and stores

tipping.hotels: Small tips for porters and housekeeping are appreciated
tipping.guides: 10% tip is appreciated for tour guides
tipping.restaurants: 10% tip is customary for good service, though not always expected
tipping.taxis: Rounding up the fare is common

weather.title: The Central African Republic has a tropical climate with two distinct seasons: a dry season from November to April and a wet season from May to October. The country experiences hot temperatures year-round, with high humidity during the rainy season.

when_to_visit.title: Dry Season
when_to_visit.short_description: Hot and dry weather, making this the best time to visit. Perfect for wildlife viewing in national parks, exploring cities, and outdoor activities. Ideal conditions for safaris and sightseeing

when_to_visit.title: Shoulder Season
when_to_visit.short_description: Transition periods with occasional rain showers. Still manageable for travel, but be prepared for some rainfall. Good time to visit before or after the peak dry season

when_to_visit.title: Wet Season
when_to_visit.short_description: Heavy rainfall and high humidity. Challenging conditions for travel, with flooding possible in some areas. Not ideal for most tourists, though the countryside is lush and green

weather.best_time: The best time to visit the Central African Republic is during the dry season from November to April when the weather is hot and dry, making it ideal for wildlife viewing in national parks, exploring cities, and outdoor activities
